title: Quiz 4: Family Planning Methods
description: Comprehensive test on all family planning methods, including pills, injections, implants, IUDs, and barrier methods.

questions.question: What should a woman do if she misses 3 or more Combined Oral Contraceptive (COC) pills in a row?

options.text: Take all missed pills at once
Discard the pack and wait for next period
Use condoms for 7 days and continue taking pills
Take 2 pills daily until caught up

questions.explanation: Missing 3+ pills reduces protection. She must use backup contraception (condoms) for 7 days while continuing the pills.
questions.hint: Protection is lost, so backup is needed.

questions.question: Progestin-Only Pills (POPs) are recommended for breastfeeding mothers because they do not suppress milk production.
questions.explanation: Estrogen in COCs can reduce milk supply; POPs contain no estrogen and are safe for breastfeeding.

questions.question: Match the contraceptive implant with its duration of effectiveness:
questions.explanation: Jadelle (2 rods, 5 yrs), Implanon (1 rod, 3 yrs), Sino-Implant (2 rods, 4 yrs).

questions.question: Which of the following are criteria for the Lactational Amenorrhea Method (LAM)? (Select 3)

options.text: Baby is less than 6 months old
Baby is sleeping through the night

questions.explanation: LAM works if: Baby < 6 months + No Period + Exclusive Breastfeeding (day & night).
questions.hint: Rule of 3: Age, Feeding type, Menstruation status.

questions.question: Emergency Contraceptive Pills (ECPs) can prevent pregnancy if taken within how many hours after unprotected sex?
questions.explanation: ECPs are effective up to 120 hours (5 days), though effectiveness is higher the sooner they are taken.

questions.question: The injectable contraceptive DMPA (Depo Provera) is given every ___BLANK___ months.
questions.explanation: DMPA is a 3-month injectable. (NET-EN is 2 months).

questions.question: Which of the following is a key advantage of the Copper IUD?

options.text: It is hormone-free and long-acting (10+ years)

questions.explanation: Copper IUDs are non-hormonal and effective for 10-12 years. They may actually increase bleeding.

questions.question: Vasectomy is immediately effective as a contraceptive method right after the surgery.
questions.explanation: Vasectomy is NOT immediately effective. It takes about 3 months or 20 ejaculations to clear remaining sperm from the ducts.
questions.hint: Are there still sperm in the tubes?

questions.question: Which of the following methods provide dual protection (Pregnancy + STIs)? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Only barrier methods like male and female condoms prevent the exchange of fluids that transmit STIs.

questions.question: Arrange the steps for GATHER counseling in the correct order:
questions.explanation: G-A-T-H-E-R: Greet, Ask, Tell, Help, Explain, Return.
